title: Calories in Saltine Crackers
meta_description: Learn calories in crackers saltines for a standard serving of 5, including full macros, sodium details, and preparation tweaks to fit your diet.
assumptions: Plain saltine crackers, standard commercial variety (e.g., Nabisco or similar), about 3g per cracker, no toppings or added fats.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, size, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A serving of 5 saltine crackers provides about 63 kcal, primarily from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one saltine cracker?
faqs.a: About 13 kcal per plain saltine cracker.

faqs.q: What is the carb content in saltine crackers?
faqs.a: High in carbsâ€”about 10.8 g for 5 crackers, with minimal fiber.

faqs.q: Are saltine crackers high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, 5 crackers have around 165 mg sodium; opt for low-sodium if watching intake.

faqs.q: Do saltine crackers have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Modest amounts: 1.4 g protein and 1.4 g fat per 5 crackers.

faqs.q: How do calories in crackers saltines compare to other snacks?
faqs.a: Lower than chips (150+ kcal per serving) but higher carb-focused than nuts.
